title: How to Catch a Cricket Inside a Building

steps.title: Locate the cricket(s).
steps.content: Locate the cricket(s). In order to do this you will need a quiet house. Carefully go from room to room listening for the characteristic chirping. [2] X Research source Crickets can usually be found underneath furniture or appliances and in closets. If, however, you suddenly turn the lights on in a previously dark room they may be out in the open. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the materials listed in the Things You'll Need section below.
steps.content: Gather the materials listed in the Things You'll Need section below. A large, clear drinking glass is preferable, so that the rim can safely enclose the cricket without out touching any antennae.

steps.title: Make sure the cricket is out in the open on a mostly flat surface.
steps.content: Make sure the cricket is out in the open on a mostly flat surface. If they are underneath something, you may have to rearrange furniture or shock them out. Try flourishing a long, thin object or brandishing a flashlight in the area where the cricket is hiding. Unfortunately, you will have lost the element of surprise after that.

steps.title: Crouch down next to the cricket and position the glass directly over the bug, upside down.
steps.content: Crouch down next to the cricket and position the glass directly over the bug, upside down.

steps.title: Lower the glass slowly and steadily.
steps.content: Lower the glass slowly and steadily . If you make any jerky movements, the cricket will jump three to four feet depending on its size, so steady the hand and move down slowly until the cricket is trapped.

steps.title: Place the paper next to the glass on the floor.
steps.content: Place the paper next to the glass on the floor. Slide the glass over the paper.

steps.title: Scrunch up the paper around the edges of the glass and pick up the cricket.
steps.content: Scrunch up the paper around the edges of the glass and pick up the cricket.

steps.title: Set your cricket free through a window or door.
steps.content: Set your cricket free through a window or door.
